lines.text: Paris, January 6th, 1940. Again, she wrote all night. She stretched, looked out at the rising sun, and bundled up against the early morning chill. As if drawn by some invisible force, she headed off across the awakening city.
I love whiskey, and women on bridges in the early morning fog.
There it is. There is a heart beating. If I move, this person knows it. If I drop away, this person feels it. I exist in him. That is life. There's something happening there.
